title: How to Make No Bake Mac and Cheese

steps.headline: Bring a large pot of water to boil.
While the pot is beginning to boil, heat 1 1/2 cups milk in another large pot over medium-high heat until just simmering.
Whisk the remaining 1/4 cup of milk, flour, garlic powder, salt and pepper in a small bowl until combined.
Add the pasta once the water has boiled.
Add the frozen broccoli and continue cooking.
Add the flour mixture to the simmering milk.
steps.description: Then return to a simmer and cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture is thickened, 2 to 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove simmering milk from the heat and whisk in Cheddar, Parmesan and mustard until the cheese is melted.

text: Bring a large pot of water to boil. This should take about 5 minutes. While the pot is beginning to boil, heat 1 1/2 cups milk in another large pot over medium-high heat until just simmering.  Whisk the remaining 1/4 cup of milk, flour, garlic powder, salt and pepper in a small bowl until combined.  Add the pasta once the water has boiled. Cook pasta for 4 minutes. Add the frozen broccoli and continue cooking. Cook for 5 minutes more. Add the flour mixture to the simmering milk. Then return to a simmer and cook, whisking constantly, until the mixture is thickened, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove simmering milk from the heat and whisk in Cheddar, Parmesan and mustard until the cheese is melted.  Drain the pasta and broccoli then add the cheese sauce... Enjoy!
